Description: Fragmentary Clazomenian black-figure painted pottery hydria. Front half of body and part of one side-handle preserved. Designs black on red panels, that on the shoulder projecting beyond the other on either side; incised lines and accessories of white and purple; imperfectly fired. On the shoulder, a frieze of six Sirens to right, with long hair, fillets, and wings recurved. On the body: On the left, a Maenad to right, with long hair, fillet, necklace long close-fitting sleeved chiton, holding up wreath in left hand, confronted by an ithyphallic Satyr, dancing, with horse's hoofs. On the right, part of a similar Satyr to right confronted by a Maenad (no fillet, chiton embroidered).
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 29
Curator's comments: For a complete hydria of this type see AA 1929, 44-47, fig. 2. BMC B.126. E. Fölzer, die Hydria, pi. 6. 83. BSA xlvii, 131-C I.4.
reconstructed with BM GR 1888.0208.110, on which Findspot number '29' is pencilled.
